author: parithosh
content:
First round of hive tests for nethermind/erigon are now up. I added the `rpc-compat` tests to hive as well, and it does indeed seems like there are a lot of RPC fails that need fixing (thanks felix!) ðŸ˜„

https://hive.pectra-devnet-5.ethpandaops.io/

(note, nethermind is tagged as main, but its using the `pectra-devnet-5` branch. I forgot to update the name)

author: lucassaldanhaconsensys
content:
<@199561711278227457>  I was doing some testing with minimal. Do you know if kurtosis has been updated after deneb minimal preset was updated?
Reference: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/commit/78c6922cafbe947220ee2cae07b4b8a706968a66

I haven't dug too much into it, but I found out that Teku is not working on minimal anymore after the commit where we updated out deneb presets... So I guess it is related to that. Maybe we need to update kurtosis genesis generation or something

author: parithosh
content: its a preset value no? that's client dependent and not something we have to configure, we only have to configure the config values and those are present here: https://github.com/ethpandaops/ethereum-genesis-generator/blob/master/config-example/cl/config.yaml

author: lucassaldanhaconsensys
content: It is client dependent, but I am guessing there is some dependency on something kurtosis feeds the client. I haven't looked too much into it, only got as far as identifying that it stopped working on the commit that we updated it ðŸ˜›

author: lucassaldanhaconsensys
content: I'll look into it more tomorrow... too late now and my brain isn't really back from holiday mode ðŸ˜„

author: parithosh
content:
hmm, from what i know - there's nothing we ever had to configure on the kt side for preset values. the client has that built in ðŸ˜„ 
We normally just set:
`PRESET_BASE: $PRESET_BASE` , being either `minimal` or `mainnet` and the CL takes care of the rest

content:

author: .fjl
content: another interesting hive result: <@&1070471163219824730> is returning the `authorizationList` in `eth_getTransactionReceipt`  even though it's not required. https://hive.pectra-devnet-5.ethpandaops.io/suite.html?suiteid=1736230882-bd253c0a1bf6dea1c20b3205be00021d.json&suitename=rpc-compat#test-89

author: .fjl
content: reth is pretty close to passing all rpc-compat tests

author: mattsse
content: I see, right, I guess they shouldn't be in the receipt

content: most failures are about the addition of `blockTimestamp` in logs

author: .fjl
content: not sure why it adds that TBH

author: .fjl
content: maybe it was a well-intentioned user contribution?

author: ralexstokes
content: i can make a release, it does seem like we have settled on the final set of changes we like

author: mattsse
content: the log blocktimestamp is related to https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/issues/295 looks like we accepted a pr for this a while ago it
